item.title: Setup
item.description: Making your own Quartz Setting up Quartz requires a basic understanding of git. If you are unfamiliar, this resource is a great place to start!

item.title: Editing Content in Quartz
item.description: Editing Quartz runs on top of Hugo so all notes are written in Markdown. Folder Structure Here’s a rough overview of what’s what.

item.title: Obsidian Vault Integration
item.description: Setup Obsidian is the preferred way to use Quartz. You can either create a new Obsidian Vault or link one that your already have.

item.title: Preview Changes
item.description: If you’d like to preview what your Quartz site looks like before deploying it to the internet, the following instructions guide you through installing the proper dependencies to run it locally.

item.title: Deploying Quartz to the Web
item.description: Hosting on GitHub Pages Quartz is designed to be effortless to deploy. If you forked and cloned Quartz directly from the repository, everything should already be good to go!
Network Index This is a network learning session and everything that I Learned from my Mistakes. [[001a OSPF redistribute connected subnet]] “subnet” option changes routing table
#routing #ospf #redistribute Question : In OSPF redistribute statement - what is the difference between “redistribute connected " and “redistribute connected subnet”

#switching what is STP Dispute ? In Spanning Tree Protocol, two switches will decide who will be the root switch. Today’s project in vlan 507, Switches are connected M— MSPP—–E and M and E both were insisting itself as a root bridge.
#security Trusted Platform Module (TPM) is a hardware component that provides secure storage of cryptographic keys and other sensitive information, such as passwords and encryption keys.
Network Automation for Network Engineers [[002a Other host_vars in groups]] How to set up group_vars and children group - my mistake

If you would like to print out Group ‘GROUP1’ variables each host _vars variable Group Name : GROUP1 Host_vars : sitenum 1 2 3 4 5 # Inventory file [GROUP1] host_101 host_102 host_103 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 #host_101.

If you would like to print out Group ‘GROUP1’ variables each host _vars variable Group Name : GROUP1 Host_vars : sitenum 1 2 3 4 5 # Inventory file [GROUP1] host_101 host_102 host_103 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 #host_101.
[[002a Other host_vars in groups]] How to use ansible variable with same name and default variable manipulation. _As a network engineer, similar config can be applied to multiple device.

[[002a Ansible group_vars and host_vars precedence]] How to use ansible variable with same name and default variable manipulation. _As a network engineer, similar config can be applied to multiple device.
It is similar to [[002a1 Group_vars as default]] but I will use for SVI-L3vlans in this example. Vlans are selective not like interfaces/ports in the same model device.

Title : What makes you rethink or prevents you from it? Why do I read Think Again? “Life is about choices and decisions we make.
Opening other people’s minds Start your debate It was pretty convincing that I could train myself to rethink. The book also moves to an interpersonal rethinking by suggesting several ways to debate.

Community-Rethinking Requiring proof is an enemy of progress Does my company provide psychological safety? The range is now extended from individuals and interpersonnel rethinking to creating a learning community.

item.title: Callouts
item.description: Callout support Quartz supports the same Admonition-callout syntax as Obsidian. This includes 12 Distinct callout types (each with several aliases) Collapsable callouts See documentation on supported types and syntax here.

item.title: Configuration
item.description: Configuration Quartz is designed to be extremely configurable. You can find the bulk of the configuration scattered throughout the repository depending on how in-depth you’d like to get.

item.title: Custom Domain
item.description: Registrar This step is only applicable if you are using a custom domain! If you are using a <YOUR-USERNAME>.github.io domain, you can skip this step.

item.title: Hosting with Docker
item.description: If you want to host Quartz on a machine without using a webpage hosting service, it may be easier to install Docker Compose and follow the instructions below than to install Quartz’s dependencies manually.

item.title: Ignoring Notes
item.description: Quartz Ignore Edit ignoreFiles in config.toml to include paths you’d like to exclude from being rendered. 1 2 3 4 5 6 .

item.title: Quartz Philosophy
item.description: â€œ[One] who works with the door open gets all kinds of interruptions, but [they] also occasionally gets clues as to what the world is and what might be important.

item.title: Search
item.description: Quartz supports two modes of searching through content. Full-text Full-text search is the default in Quartz. It produces results that exactly match the search query.

item.title: Showcase
item.description: Want to see what Quartz can do? Here are some cool community gardens :) Quartz Documentation (this site!) Jacky Zhao’s Garden Scaling Synthesis - A hypertext research notebook AWAGMI Intern Notes Shihyu’s PKM SlRvb’s Site Course notes for Information Technology Advanced Theory Brandon Boswell’s Garden Siyang’s Courtyard Data Dictionary ğŸ§ sspaeti.

item.title: Troubleshooting and FAQ
item.description: Still having trouble? Here are a list of common questions and problems people encounter when installing Quartz. While you’re here, join our Discord :)

item.title: Updating
item.description: Haven’t updated Quartz in a while and want all the cool new optimizations? On Unix/Mac systems you can run the following command for a one-line update!
